Reason: The 'memtable_offheap_space_in_mb' configuration is performance-sensitive. This is because it directly impacts the total memory usage for memtables in the system, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. The configuration involves shifting the value obtained from DatabaseDescriptor left by 20 bits to convert from MB to bytes, and this limit is used in creating different types of MemtablePools based on the memtable allocation type. Additionally, the triggering frequency of this configuration depends on the memtable_cleanup_threshold set in the DatabaseDescriptor, and exceeding the off-heap memory limit can lead to flushes to free up memory. Setting the limit too low can result in frequent flushes impacting performance, while setting it too high can lead to excessive memory usage and potential out-of-memory errors.
